weather_report:
Current conditions in Evanston, Illinois reveal a damp chill settling in as temperatures hover in the low 40s, accompanied by a noticeably humid atmosphere. The winds, whipping from the northeast, are fierce, reaching speeds that create a noticeable bite and send leaves swirling across the street. As we look toward the day ahead, expect a slight chance of rain overnight before dawn. The clouds will dominate the sky, and temperatures will dip only slightly, settling around 44. Tomorrow, the sun may peek through the clouds with highs nearing the upper 40s, yet the east winds will continue to remind us of the approaching winter.

The prevalent clouds lend an offcast appearance over the waters of Lake Michigan, contributing to a somewhat dreary scenery. Wave conditions are likely moderate given the strong winds, though it is not the ideal time for beach activities—so one might want to reconsider plans for a stroll along the shore. With the weather feeling rather wintry for mid-November, dressing in layers, perhaps a warm coat accompanied by a scarf and sturdy footwear, will be essential for comfort should you venture outdoors. This is certainly reflective of seasonal norms as we transition deeper into late fall, reminding us that the holiday season is fast approaching.
